crown.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a circle made of gold and decorated with jewels, worn by kings and queens on their heads
crown.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a circle, sometimes made of things such as leaves or flowers, worn by someone who has won a special honour
crown.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: an artificial top for a damaged tooth
crown.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: the top part of a hat or someoneâ€™s head
crown.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: a hat with a high crown
auburn hair piled high on the crown of her head
crown.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: the top of a hill or something shaped like a hill
crown.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: They drove to the crown of Zion hill and on into town.
The masonry at the crown of the arch is paler than on either curve.
crown.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: the position you have if you have won an important sports competition
crown.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: Can she retain her Wimbledon crown?
He went on to win the world crown in 2001.
crown.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: the standard unit of money in some European countries
crown.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: an old British coin. Four crowns made a pound.
crown.translation[0].definitions[8].defi: a mark, sign, badge etc in the shape of a crown, used especially to show rank or quality
crown.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to place a crown on the head of a new king or queen as part of an official ceremony in which they become king or queen
crown.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Louis was crowned at Reims in 814.
In 1896 Nicholas was crowned as Tsar.
crown.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to give someone a title for winning a competition
crown.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to make something perfect or complete, by adding an achievement etc
crown.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: a long career crowned with a peaceful retirement
crown.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to put a protective top on a damaged tooth
crown.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: to hit someone on the head
crown.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: the government of a country such as Britain that is officially led by a king or queen
crown.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: The islands are possessions of the Crown.
crown.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: the English name for a unit of currency used in Denmark, Norway, and Sweden
crown.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: The Swedish drug company had pre-tax profits of 545 million crowns.
